choices.A: Document the reason for the request
choices.F: Write the SLA for the sales department authorizing the change
choices.E: Create a honeypot to store the file on for the customers to use
choices.C: Follow the company's approval process for the implementation
choices.D: Install a TFTP server for the customers to use for the transfer
choices.B: Scan the file for malware to protect the sales department's computers

questions.question_text: A network administrator receives a call from the sales department requesting ports 20 and 21 be opened on the company's firewall to allow customers to retrieve a large file. Which of the following should the administrator perform BEFORE making the needed changes? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
If you arent allowed to change them without approval you will have to ask someone higher up meaning you have give reason and follow the appropriate procedures

"The user did not modify the laptop in any way"... Therefore the Wifi would still be on, on the laptop. Not modifying a laptop in "any way" indicates that everything in exactly the same on the laptop as it was before. Exam questions should not be misleading or open to interpretation. They should be specific and factual. This question is NOT factual. It in fact it actually lies to you. Don't get me wrong, the answer is still where I would start, but it doesn't indicate whether the statement came from. If it came from the user, then yeah, you can assume that something could have accidentally changed on the laptop without them knowing. If the statement came from compTIA and is strictly information about the situation in the question, then you are to assume the problem isn't with the laptop... because compTIA told you that themselves! This is a poorly written question.

comments.content:
What if the wireless component on the lap-top just simply locked. toggling the wireless on/off should restart the hardware and software- No?
If that was in real life Scenario, I would ask the user to restart the lap-top entirely and should've worked.

discussion.content:
You're thinking slightly too logically.
They want us to assume that the user turned on airplane mode, thus disabling wifi.
The average user won't even investigate much themselves, they'll simply put in a ticket and wait for support to fix the "problem", except the real problem is in the chair.
The only logical answer is A; mind you the other users are not having any sort of problems, which means the wireless controller, WLAN IP scope and WAP settings are in good shape.

In my opinion, I would have checked that the wireless switch was possibly turned off, but I agree with all of you who say that this question is worded poorly. I mean, come on..."The user did not modify the laptop in any way." This would force my theory to go above and beyond the physical layer. I guess the key word in this specific scenario for figuring out the answer would be "functional." CompTIA needs to do better at wording these question, i am just saying.

Consider this: In no way does the question say that the laptop belongs to the user. For all intents and purposes, the user could have borrowed the laptop the day before and used it, and then borrow it again the following day. The question says "the user did not modify the laptop in anway..." but this not not necessarily mean that it was not modified in any way.

The point is, that it makes sense to start troubleshooting from the physical layer first.

This question misleading. Checking the Wi-Fi toggle switch would be the first thing I would do, but the question states, "The user did not modify the laptop in any way". They could have worded the sentence a little better.
Can't it be the scope? Because otherwise the answer is that the laptop was modified.
Try to look at it accidentally, like he accidentally turned of the wireless switch when he took the laptop out of the bag. :)

it's possible of accidentally changing the wireless switch of a laptop and of all the options that seemed like the only one that would only affect that user. The key is that he is the only one with the problem, all other options will affect multiple users.
we are assuming that the user accidentally turn off the wireless switch, uhmm. Weird

They maintain a percentage of poorly worded, ambiguous questions to allow them to dial in the desired pass/fail ratio by just altering the number of those type of questions in a given test cycle. "Too many passing this month? Sprinkle in some more of the 50/50 questions!"

I've had this exact same question on many Net+ practice tests. Another way this could be interpreted would be that he didn't change anything manually but perhaps when he took the laptop out of his backpack or moved it to another location the user might have accidentally turned the physical wireless switch off.
Uhmmm. Wouldn't that fall under "The user did not modify the laptop in any way,"

comments.content: My thoughts exactly, this is just a terrible question in general. Just gonna hope this one doesn't show up on the test.

Consider this..."The user CLAIMS they did not modify the laptop in any way,.." 

Does that appear a little more clearer for you?

99.9% of the time the problem is between the chair and the computer. Just because the ticket says that the computer wasn't modified doesn't mean that's true. And for troubleshooting you always start with the physical layer.
Yes, but that's not what the question says.

questions.question_text: A user reports that a laptop cannot connect to the Internet despite the fact the wireless Internet was functioning on it yesterday. The user did not modify the laptop in any way, and the wireless Internet is functional on other users' laptops. Which of the following issues should be reviewed to help the user to connect to the wireless network?

choices.C: WLAN IP address out of scope

questions.question_text: A network administrator wants to increase the confidentiality of the system by hardening the authentication process. Currently, the users log in using usernames and passwords to access the system. Which of the following will increase the authentication factor to three?

choices.D: Enforcing a stronger password policy and using a hand geometry scan
choices.B: Adding a fingerprint reader and retina scanner
choices.C: Using a smart card and RSA token
choices.A: Adding a fingerprint reader to each workstation and providing a RSA authentication token

discussion.content: There are three common factors used for authentication: Something you know (such as a password) Something you have (such as a smart card) Something you are (such as a fingerprint or other biometric method)

comments.content: I agree. Thanks for the clarity on this.
both of the devices on C fall under "Something you have"
Answer "C" are both items you have which can be taken from you.

discussion.content: Why is A preferred over C?

questions.question_text: A network technician is building a network for a small office. The office currently has cable TV and now requires access to the Internet without adding any cabling other than what is already in place. Which of the following solutions should the technician install to meet these requirements?

discussion.content: DOCSIS stands for Data Over Cable Service Interface Specification. It is an international telecommunications standard the addition of high-bandwidth data transfer to an existing coaxial cable TV system. This is an important feature to know because it influences which modem you get for a cable Internet connection.

questions.question_text: The server team has just installed an application across three different servers. They are asking that all requests to the application are spread evenly across the three servers. Which of the following should the network team implement to fulfil the request?

discussion.content: oad balancing refers to the process of distributing a set of tasks over a set of resources, with the aim of making their overall processing more efficient. Load balancing can optimize the response time and avoid unevenly overloading some compute nodes while other compute nodes are left idle.
I was going to raise absolute hell if it wasn't load balancer
If you have ever hauled a trailer, you can also think of load balancing like you're loading the trailer. You want to load the trailer as evenly as possible.
